mission.title: Our mission
mission.paragraph1: Ukraine2Work was founded with a clear purpose: to connect Ukrainian refugees with meaningful employment in the Netherlands, allowing them to utilize their professional skills and build economic independence.
mission.paragraph2: We believe that access to employment is essential for successful integration and rebuilding lives. By removing barriers between qualified Ukrainian professionals and Dutch employers, we create opportunities that benefit both parties.
mission.paragraph3: As a non-profit organization, all our services are free for Ukrainian job seekers, focusing on providing practical support, resources, and guidance throughout the entire job search process.

legal.title: What You Need to Know as a Ukrainian Refugee in the Netherlands
legal.description: Under the EU Temporary Protection Directive, Ukrainian refugees can work in the Netherlands without a work permit. This means that after registering with the municipality and obtaining an O-document (proof of residence), you can immediately start looking for a job. It is important that you register with the IND (Immigration and Naturalization Service) within four weeks to legalize your stay and work status.

workPermit.title: Work permit
workPermit.description: Ukrainian refugees do not need a work permit to do paid work in the Netherlands. Employers are required to register you with the UWV before you start working.

equalRights.title: Equal rights
equalRights.description: As a Ukrainian refugee, you have the same rights as Dutch workers, such as fair wages, safe working conditions, and access to health insurance.

temporaryProtection.title: Temporary protection
temporaryProtection.description: The temporary protection for Ukrainian refugees has been extended until March 4, 2026. This means you can continue working in the Netherlands until then.

howToFindWork.title: How to Find Work?
howToFindWork.description: At Ukraine2Work, we help you step by step. You just need to create your profile on our platform, where we ask about your skills, work experience, and ambitions. Our system ensures that you are quickly matched with the right employers in various sectors.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Do you have questions about working in the Netherlands or need support in finding work? Contact us, and we'll be happy to help you further.

residencePermit.question: What if I don't have proof of residence yet?
residencePermit.answer: Make sure to register with the municipality where you are staying and make an appointment with the IND to collect your O-document. Without this proof, you are not allowed to work.

volunteer.question: Can I work as a volunteer?
volunteer.answer: Yes, Ukrainian refugees can do volunteer work without a work permit.
